topic.title: SHI Block to Line OTN and System OTN Subsystem Connectivity Rules

body.p: The following rules, in addition to the PAM4 and NRZ rules, apply when selecting SERDES to use for connection to the line OTN or system OTN subsystems. Connections from the SERDES to the line or OTN subsystem are defined by the prov_mode, pin_mode, and serdes_port_id arguments to the g5_api_otn_prov() API.

li.p: Rule: an OTN interface can connect to any SERDES bank.
Rule: each OTLC.n / FOIC1.k module framer interface (MFI) associated with an OTUC of an OTUCn group can connect to different SERDEs banks.

Rule: each OTLC.n / FOIC1.k MFI must connect to one SHI block (for NRZ) or SHI block sub-group (for PAM4). A corollary to this rule is each OTLC.n / FOIC1.k MFI cannot be split across SHI blocks (for NRZ) or SHI block sub-groups (for PAM4).

body.p: Consider a OTUC6 composed of 6 x OTLC.2 PAM 4 interfaces as an example. The six OTLC.2 interfaces could be connected as follows.

li.p: OTLC.2 #1 connected to bank A, lanes 0/1 of SHI2, device SERDES pins SA_RXI/TXO_P/N[9:8].
OTLC.2 #2 connected to bank A, lanes 2/3 of SHI5, device SERDES pins SA_RXI/TXO_P/N[23:22].
OTLC.2 #3 connected to bank B, lanes 2/3 of SHI1, device SERDES pins SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[7:6].
OTLC.2 #4 connected to bank B, lanes 0/1 of SHI3, device SERDES pins SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[13:12].
OTLC.2 #5 connected to bank C, lanes 0/1 of SHI4, device SERDES pins SC_RXI/TXO_P/N[17:16].
OTLC.2 #6 connected to bank C, lanes 2/3 of SHI0, device SERDES pins SC_RXI/TXO_P/N[3:2].

body.p: The example illustrates the rules but is likely not a practical SERDES lane selection as the MFIs for a OTUCn signal would typically use SERDES lanes that are near to each other for optimal PCB routing to an optical module or digital signal processing (DSP) device.
